announcements: Thursday, Friday, and Saturday next, July 19, 20, and 21; and on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday, July 23, 24, 25, and 26
To commence on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday, at Half-past Eight o'Clock; and on Monday, at One o'Clock in the day; and on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday, after the Races are over.

N. B. Mr. Ramosamee, principal Performer, wishes to intimate to the Public, that there is no Truth in the Statement as to one of the Jugglers Dying in consequence of swallowing the Sword, or being Shot with a Pistol in Ireland.

featuredAttractionsForShow: The Indian Jugglers will re-commence their Unrivalled Performances.

These Extraordinary Indians, are natives of Seringapatam, and have been exhibiting for some time past in the Metropolis, before many of the Nobility, who unanimously pronounced them to be the first Masters of the Art ever seen in this Kingdom.
A series of Evolutions with Four Hollow Brass Balls, about the Size of Oranges!
Stringing Beads with his Mouth, At the same time turning Rings on his Fingers and Toes!
Erecting a Curious Pagoda on the top of his nose, and removing the same with surprising ingenuity.
His manly Activity in Throwing a Large Ball, The Size of an Eighteen Pound Shot
Throws this Ball of Twelve Pounds round his Head. Without the assistance of his hands
Several other Achievements, too numerous to mention in the limits of a Hand-bill
The performance concludes with the Wonderful Feat of Swallowing a Sword, Two Feet Long.
notes: Featured Attractions listed are for the most part titles only, with detailed blurbs describing the acts that can be found on the image itself.
